title: Frustrated because i need help but im not sure if i can get it, please help.
content:
This might be long... but thank you for reading anyway.

On November 4th, I had the worst panic attack of my life. I thought I was going to die. Since the beginning of October 2024, I had been seeking professional help due to a relapse of my depression and anxiety, caused by PTSD that was triggered when I had to get on a plane.

I’m not from here, I’m from another country. I had already received psychological help before, and I was able to improve a lot, get stronger, and move forward, of course with the help of a psychologist and anxiety medication.

I ended up seeking professional help here in the United States. I went to the local mental health center in the city I’m living in, it’s free. I managed to get them to prescribe me medication (even though I feel like they never really properly evaluated me to give me the right medicine). They gave me medication for anxiety and depression.

The thing is, everything changed on November 4th, 2024. That day, I was fine, I had a lot of things to do, and I was feeling okay, with a little anxiety, so I decided to take my anxiety pill (which I had only taken once before, this would be the second time) and it caused the worst effect instead of calming me down. I felt like I had lost my mind. My boyfriend wasn’t home, only my roommate was there. I called my boyfriend to come home because I couldn’t calm down. I started screaming with all my strength, I lost the strength in my body, I was falling, and I could only scream. I started twitching in painful ways, I really thought I was going to die. My boyfriend ended up calling 911 because he got scared. When they arrived at the house, not only the ambulance came but also the police. Imagine a person having a horrible panic attack, with police and paramedics in their living room, in their safe space. I couldn’t calm down, seeing them and them cornering me made me feel so sick. They took my blood pressure and temperature. They said I had a fever and needed to go to the hospital to rule out an allergic reaction to the medication I had taken. That was from the paramedic, who was quite sweet and helpful. They asked me to go in the ambulance with my boyfriend, but I just couldn’t move, I was so scared to go with them. So that’s when the police intervened and told me that I had to go or “things were going to get worse.” I wanted to go but mentally I just couldn’t, and my body was flooded with panic. Since I didn’t comply, the police forced me onto the sofa, hurting me physically while handcuffing me. I screamed in pain and fear, I never thought something like this would happen to me. My panic was beyond the sky, it was uncontrollable at this point. With my hands handcuffed, they took me to the police car, barefoot because they didn’t let me find my shoes. I screamed, I cried, I begged them not to make me do this. The police officer just told me to shut up and started driving at high speed down the highway. We got to the hospital, and I entered, barefoot, handcuffed, screaming, and crying. Everything hurt. They took me to a room and handcuffed me to the bed. The nurses mocked me and told me to be quiet. They didn’t want to give me water. One nurse came with a glass, a mocking face, and told me, “I’ll only give you water if you stop crying.” It was so humiliating. They kept me in the hospital for 9 hours, not telling me anything. They took off the handcuffs because “I was behaving.” I was just crying. Later, I got to see my boyfriend, and then I called my family, who were worried in another country, thinking the worst had happened to their daughter. I left the hospital 9 hours later, with a police officer saying, “Yeah, sorry, it was all a misunderstanding, you can go now.”

I never felt so humiliated in my life. Now my nervous system is completely messed up. I have trauma from that. Since that day, I’ve been in fight or flight mode. The therapist I sought here simply didn’t help, and neither did the psychiatrist. I’m dealing with so much anxiety every day, I’m having a lot of relapses, and it’s becoming really hard to move forward. I haven’t gone out with my friends in months, and this is becoming difficult to handle.

I just wanted to vent. I hope this doesn’t happen to anyone else, and that they train the police in this country better to learn how to handle panic attacks or anything related to mental health.

title: Lasting symptoms after 5 years
content: Does PTSD chang things… forever?  I’m undiagnosed but absolutely consider myself to have had PTSD/have lasting effects.  When stuff first happened ect ect all that- I ended up basically physically ill from trauma for months.  Like unable to eat, unable to sleep, constant nightmares, constantly throwing up from anxiety/throwing up from triggers.  I more than once can recall sitting in the tub with my mom next to me trying to get me to eat little bites of food at 5 in the morning.  Real bad times, 100% PTSD.  That was 5 years ago.  Nowadays I still have horrible memory problems, my short term memory is only about half of what it once was.  I forget a lot of stuff, names, what someone said to me just a day ago, plans I make.  And sometimes even when reminded of these things it’s just- gone still.  Like they remind me but I don’t remember knowing it in the first place.  I dissociate pretty much 100% of the time, SUPER severe derealization 24/7. I feel like I’ve been sleeping for 5 years.  Still sometimes have physical responses to triggers.  It’s been so long, does shit rewire your brain permanently? Can I reverse all this?  Feels like I’m only able to be partly alive.  I miss living.  I miss safety.

title: I’ve been kinda going on a mental health downfall lately.
content:
Hello, I’m 25m and I’ve been in the U.S. Army since I was 17. I have 2 deployments under my belt and just an FYI I’m not in any combat related MOS but we do work out of a combat zone. 

It’s end of the holiday break for me right now, I saw all my friends and family and had a really great time. 

Lately I’ve caught myself thinking about some pretty dangerous situations I’ve been though in the past. 

One was when I was deployed to Syria. I remember I was sitting in a 120 degree porta potty, fighting for my life while trying to shit. But mid way though that, I heard “incoming! Incoming!” Over the loud speaker and then C-RAMs buzzing. At first I was thinking it’s a drill cause it’s not crazy for that to be going off though out the week. But I started hearing explosions in the distance and people yelling and I don’t know why, but I stayed. And the explosions starting getting louder and louder to the point we’re it’s like a fire cracker going off next to your ear. But all I could really think about was “man, dying on this toilet would be a really shitty way to die” then I started thinking about “what if one mortar lands right next to me and a piece of shrapnel cuts though this plastic porta potty and shreds my brains” and that was all I could think about, me: dead in a porta potty. Then after it was all over, we took a head count, nobody was injured and we continued our work day. 

But nowadays whenever I think of that, I get emotional, I feel scared, weak and just less of a person. I think about how my friends would’ve seen me if I would’ve been killed. It’s even worse when I think about my mom seeing me like that. In a casket with an American flag over me. I love serving my country and I love what I do. I’ll go to the end of the earth for some of the guys that are under me but lately I feel more and more sad and scared about what’s going to happen in my future. Especially with politics right now. Freaks me out when I see the news some days. 

Anyways, I think I’m gunna start going to therapy for it this year. It’s one of my resolutions for 2025. I just needed to spill the beans for some people I don’t know me or whatever. Maybe I’ll even inspire somebody else to have the same resolution with me.

title: Last night I told my BF I have PTSD and now I feel extremely guilty, anxious, and stupid.
content:
Last night I was experiencing extreme difficulty sleeping, my anxiety was spiked and my heart rate was considerably rapid for a long time which lead to heightened fight or flight and paranoia. I usually am very private and secretive about my PTSD, my best friend is the only other person who is aware of it, and I'm generally a pretty emotionally guarded person. Lately I've been trying to push myself to be more open and communicative about my emotions because I feel like that emotional avoidance is usually what pushes me to feel self isloated and lonely, and is often the downfall in my relationships.My boyfriend and I have been dating for about 3 months now, he has mental health issues of his own and we've been able to help each other open up in ways we haven't in other relationships and we have a strong mutual understanding that I haven't felt with another partner before. 

So instead of my usual self isolating in this situation I texted my boyfriend and asked him if I could crash at his place for the night because I was freaking out a little going to sleep and thought it would help if I had another person in the room with me. When I got to his place he started offering solutions to help me sleep but I explained to him that I have PTSD and that I probably got triggered by something earlier in the day that made my fight or flight react and that j just needed to calm my anxiety and my heart rate. He didn't seem phased or reactive at all when I opened up, instead he tried to accommodate me as best he could, invited me on an outing with his friends for the next night, told me he loved me, and checked on me intermittently. Writing it all out now is making me realize that it's probably not as big a deal as I'm making it out to be, but I can't help feeling stupid, ashamed, and guilty for telling him that I have PTSD. I'm second-guessing if telling him was the right thing to do.

I've noticed a lot of posts of other people with PTSD/cptsd saying that it's better off to never tell anyone about their condition, and that no one really needs to know because they'll never understand. But honestly I feel like the opposite is true, I think if you want a healthy long-term relationship with someone you should put everything out on the table and communicate, but on the other hand I still feel very anxious about the entire night. Did I make the right move?

title: I Nearly Set My Apartment on Fire -- Fire Trauma
content:
I am a 14 year old boy and today, while trying a recipe, I started a grease fire. The recipe I had in mind included some hot oil and, having never experimented extensively with it, I never knew how to handle it. I researched sunflower oil's boiling point and, without further a doubt, I turned the stove on and waited for it to heat up. Now, oil doesn't react to heat as water does, and it's very hard to see the signs of overheating. 

The last red flag I should've seen was the oil producing smoke and smelling burnt, right before the inevitable flame started. I was at all times near the stove and when I saw the fire starting, I got immediately weak and overwhelmed. It was like watching a fiasco starting to happen and having to stop it ASAP. 

Now, I was informed about grease fires and how if water is thrown on them they immediately expand, so I quickly took a bowl and placed it over the fire, after which I quickly turned the heat off. The scariest part of this is I was alone, my parents away for 2 days and having to handle the fire all by myself. Images of it expanding and wrecking down my house were flying across my head as I closed the window and door of the kitchen so oxygen wouldn't circulate and fuel the fire. I tried switching the bowl on top of the kettle with the fire to a lid, but immediately after I took the bowl off the oil caught fire again, even more intensely. The fire kept going under my bowl and getting stronger, then weaker, then stronger again. I was terrified.

  
The fire got pretty darn big, but I managed to suffocate it. The questions left were... What would've happened if a week previously I wouldn't have watched some insignificant Youtube video about grease fires and the dangers they behold? What if I would've thrown water on the fire, unknowingly, and expand the fire? I got 2 burns on my hand, but what if I wouldn't have known how to settle the fire? What if this fire would've ended my life horrifically?

  
Now, at night, I struggle to sleep while looking through other fire stories. I know my incident isn't nearly as overwhelming as others -- heck, my fire was around the height of an average arm, but I am still unable to sleep. I feel the smoke again, how I felt when I saw the flame and how I felt knowing the fire may start again, or the bowl might break which would make the oil fire spill across the floor. I feel like at any moment, somewhere in my house, a fire could start, I imagine how my whole building is engulfed in flames and I am left surrounded in them, basically just worrying about how the situation could derail, only having not had the information about grease fires. Perhaps, a decision of reading an article one month ago is what saved my life now.

PSA: My parents DO know about the incident I had.

I want to hear more fire survivor stories and how you got over the trauma of it. Thanks!

title: Does anyone else get irrationally angry/anxious in open spaces? Like reverse claustrophobia? (Not agoraphobia)
content:
I have to sit with my back against the wall where I can keep an eye on everyone, and I have to have my ear buds with music in so I don't get overstimulated by other people around me cause I'm also autistic.

I get extremely tense at the sensation of people walking around/behind me if that makes sense, and I'll rage if I get triggered multiple times in a row in a short amount of time. 

If I can't sit somewhere quiet and secluded at all times I'll have a nervous breakdown and become a walking time bomb which turns me into a major bitch to be around. It really sucks and I hate being like that but I have no control over it, I try my best not to take it out on anyone.

I just had a breakdown and I got so desperate for space that I locked myself in a storage room. I'm not in school but I'm in a school type setting where there's virtually zero places to escape in times like this, or the options I do have are almost always taken by someone else.

Almost everyone I'm surrounded with triggers me on a daily basis, from oblivious people not respecting my personal space/treating me like I'm invisible, to someone snorting loudly/blowing their nose/clearing their throat every 5 minutes 24/7 instead of taking mucinex, people randomly trying to talk to me while I have my headphones in etc.

I'm trying so hard not to relapse on smoking weed but the chronic stress from feeling trapped all the time is killing me/is honestly probably even worse for me than smoking at this point.

Does anyone else get like this when everything gets to be too much for them? What do you do to cope?

I don't want people to think I'm entitled or feel that everyone has to cater to my needs at all times, I know I can't always get what I want in life but that's not the issue.

It's more like everyone around me is overly extroverted and ignorant to any type of negativity in the world while I'm the introvert outcast that always gets the short end of the stick in every social setting, while everyone else gets to make friends and have fun without feeling crowded...

It just pisses me off cause no matter how hard I try I can never fit in anywhere with anyone. And every time I try to politely explain PTSD to someone and say that I can't just "cheer up", it goes right over their heads.

(Sorry for the TLDR, I hope this rant actually made sense to someone besides me lol 💀)

title: I feel like a murderer
content:
I guess I am technically. Manslaughter maybe. I’m 17. But I would right now have a 3 year old child. Obviously having a toddler at 17 wouldn’t be ideal. And I’m mentally ill. But I didn’t want my baby to die. I got pregnant at 14 from rape. I had already been raped and abused multiple times in my life. And this time I was humiliated online because my rapist filmed and took pictures. And posted them and sold them online. 

The police didn’t do anything. So a few weeks after the rape I tried to kill myself and was in a coma for a day. After I got released from hospital I was still suicidal. So I was drinking and doing drugs to cope. For months but a started to gain weight rapidly and get sickness and cravings and stuff and I was worried. I looked pregnant too. I was in denial though. My whole life I wanted to one day have a big family with lots of children. But like WAY in the future.

I was scared of taking a pregnancy test because I didn’t want it to be true. But I did stop hurting myself and doing drugs incase I was pregnant because I didn’t want hurt my baby if I was pregnant. I was so scared of my family and friends disowning me I didn’t tell anyone about my fear of being pregnant. I wasn’t allowed out of the house on my own because of the suicide attempt. So I didn’t want to have to ask my family and I was scared if I’d ask the GP they’d have to tell my parents.

A few more months went by and I started to accept it. And I decided I was going to take a pregnancy test. Because my parents allowed me to go to town with my friend in a week from when I decided to take the test. I decided I was going to steal a pregnancy test without her noticing while we went shopping. And I honestly started to in a maybe messed up way love my child. I thought it was a sign I needed to get better. And stay alive. So I could give my baby a good life. 

I knew it was going to be hard but I also thought it would be worth it. And I started thinking about names and looking at baby clothes and saving money up. I for some reason decided I didn’t want an abortion at this point. And I didn’t want to have to give up my baby so I was going to keep it and I felt comforted knowing I would have someone who needs me. Which I know isn’t the way to go about having a baby but I genuinely thought the universe was giving me this child so I’d turn my life around and all my problems will be solved. 

But then a few days before meeting my friend I started my period again. I was in extreme agony and within seconds the blood had already soaked through my underwear and my bed. And I was screaming in pain. My parents thought it was just a really heavy period and my mother gave me these really thick pads she uses when she has her period. And I was telling her I don’t think this is normal and she said it happens to her sometimes when she has a heavy period and she gave me paracetamol. I ended up crawling because I felt really faint and in pain and couldn’t walk to the bathroom to put on the pad but threw up when I got there. Then I was putting on the pad and the deformed baby came out. Like it was a fully formed feetus but in peices. I could make out its and hands and feet and head. And I started sobbing. 

I felt like it was all my fault. And I still do. I shouldn’t have done drugs or alcohol or tried to kill myself then my baby would’ve lived. And it was pretty far along so it might’ve felt the pain by that point. 

I’m not against abortion I was considering abortion but I had chosen to have this baby. Now I have fertility issues and will probably never be able to have a baby. And even if I could I don’t think I’d be mentally able to. After the miscarriage I went back to my old ways of drinking and doing drugs. And trying to kill myself. The baby was what I changed for. Yet that still wasn’t good enough.

title: Did Bilbo have PTSD?
content:
One of the quotes I use most often to describe how I feel on bad days is "I feel thin, sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread."  This line comes from Bilbo when he's talking to Gandalf towards the beginning of the first book.  I've been using it for years, and only just now thought about the character who gave it to me.  

Bilbo was certainly traumatized, and I wonder if the One Ring wasn't meant to symbolize that trauma, how it makes you feel inside.  And counterintuitively, how greedy it makes you feel towards keeping that trauma, holding onto it even though it makes you feel awful, changes you into a monster, wracks your mental health to the edge and then shoves it over.

Hell, look at Smeagol/Gollum.  If he isn't a prime example of self-isolation, I don't know what is!  And he stopped at nothing, chasing that dragon of despair and awfulness.

Idk, maybe I'm reading too much into it.  But I relate the fuck out of it.

title: OD death. First on scene. One year later. Still traumatized.
content:
Like the title says, it’s been just over a year since I stopped on my way to work to help someone who I thought slipped and fell. 
I was not prepared for what happened next. My adult daughter was with me and she called 911 and began chest compressions, I was not a narcan carrier at the time! FUCK THAT COULD HAVE SAVED HIM!
Anyway fast forward 10 minutes, I’m working on this guy try everything to will him back to life. EMT/paramedics showed up, checked him, then grabbed his shoulders and ankles and put him in the ambulance and drove away. 
Today while driving I saw a large duffle bag on the sidewalk in a pretty sketchy strip of our city, one hand on the door and the other ready to take off the seatbelt. 
Realized it wasn’t a person and BOOM, full blown panic! 
It’s 5 hours later and I’m spiralling. 
The only person who gets it is my kid and I’m not about to retraumatize her. 
My doctor has me on medication, but I don’t want to rely on it. I want to get over this feeling. 
I didn’t kill this guy, I didn’t give him meth, I didn’t deserve this mental anguish. It has literally changed me and it’s terrifying to think that this man, his choices and me stopping has changed my whole life and personality as well as putting my kid in that position. 
I hate him and I hate myself. 
I have talked to therapists, trauma councillors and my doctor. I don’t know what else to do. 
Thanks for letting me vent.

when i was 13 it was because i came to the realization that im not cis and would rather be a boy than a girl most of the time, im still trying to figure out what exactly i am, but ive figured out that much. my mom found out, had a temper tantrum, told me she "wouldnt trade her daughter for a son" and that "im a girl, so i better start acting like it". she locked me in the car after we dropped my sister off at school and yelled awful things at me the whole drive home. she told me that im sick in the head, should be locked in a mental hospital, that she didnt raise a "disgusting transexual deviant", and how people like me shouldnt be allowed to live. she kept me locked in the car an additional 10 minutes after we got home and continued to scream at me. when she finally unlocked the door, i flung myself out of the car, ran inside, and sat in a burning hot shower. im not very religious, but that day i remember praying through my tears, sobbing to any god that was out there that would listen to me to please make it all a bad dream; to just let me wake up in my bed and realize it was all an awful nightmare that didnt actually happen.

i was made to live with my dad after that.

when i was 15 i was kicked out of my dad's house after he looked at my search history and saw me looking up the process of emancipation and looking into HRT. i had come out to my dad that summer when i was 14, and he didnt have a particularly supportive reaction. he told me that he doesnt believe i actually want to be a boy, but that i think it would make my life easier and that im doing it to be different. as if i would want to be part of one of the most targeted communities in the american south to "make my life easier". makes absolutely no sense. the whole reason i was looking into emancipation was because i saw a news article about it. the idea that i might try going for it was there in the back of my head, but it wasnt an active plan. me and my dad spent most of our time arguing. we'd get into fights about things that werent important, and he would yell and scream at me. sometimes i would threaten to call CPS, because a few testimonies from me and he'd never see his kids again. a couple of times my 5 year old brother stood between us and told him to leave me alone and that if our dad hurt me, he would hurt him.

a week before my baby brother's 4th birthday one summer when i was living with my dad, my grandpa burst into the living room yelling at me to stop being such a fuck up and actually be apart of the fucking family. that if i would just act right we wouldnt have any of the problems we were dealing with at the time, and that i was being disgracful.

i had told my dad about it when i got home, and he apparently told his dad to knock it off, but left me to believe he didnt care and never told me he handled it. then it was somehow my fault for not talking to my dad or grandpa unless i had to for a few weeks.

every time me and my dad would argue, he would throw the fact that he married my mom and adopted me when i was a baby in my face. i hated it, still do. im not even allowed to look at my DNA test results because it makes HIM uncomfortable, even though we havent spoken in half a year.

im back to living with my mom now, because my dad told her that he was done with me and couldnt deal with me anymore. she ignores me not being cis, pretends that im her sweet little girl and her precious daughter. at this point ive learned to just hide the discomfort when she calls me that and try and keep myself from physically cringing. she lets me wear mens clothes and use mens products as long as i dont say i would rather be a boy, so theres no sense in complaining.

i had tried to see my dad over the summer, i really had. i made it a week before we got into a screaming match. he yelled at me over mens bodywash, and escalated the situation to saying that im a disrespectful, manipulative, pathological liar of a brat that twists the narrative of anything to victimize myself. all i do is tell it like it happened with the information i have if someone asks.

i was fully expecting to be kicked out and homeless by now, because i havent managed to stay with one parent more than a year at this point. fortunately, i wasnt, because i dont have much, let alone the means to support myself, im only making 100 bucks per paycheck right now.

i had a major problem with my old math teacher at the beginning of the school year before i transferred classes. she yelled at my whole class and called us idiots and said we were all dumber than 6th graders, in a fucking algebra 2 class. the yelling made me have a flashback, and i had a panic attack in class. my poor friend, alex, was trying to help me, but i couldnt register that it was him. i thought he was my dad and i started crying before he managed to help me realize where i was.

my mom had me switched out of her class.

i was harassed by a boy in my ag class at the beginning of the school year. its not the first time ive been harassed by someone, but it made me scared to walk to class alone, because his friends would yell after me asking why i didnt like him. it wasnt even full blown sexual harassment, he just wouldnt leave me alone depite me being obviously uncomfortable.

one of my friends found out about it after he quit bothering me for the most part, and he keeps telling me to let him know if he ever starts it up again any time this kid says anything to me, since he sits on the opposite side of my friend to me in my ag class.

hell, just this week, my mom told some random guy she drove around for uber where i work despite being hyperskeptical of strangers after multiple cases of family members being taken advantage of. she told him where i work. he showed up at my job asking for me before my shift started and my manager told him i wasnt on the schedule for the day just so he wouldnt show up again later. after i heard about it, i asked my mom why she would tell some random guy where i work and her response was "because we were having a conversation, dont question me".

i turn 16 in less than a month and im already so fucked up in the head.

i cant sleep with the door open because my parents have thrown my door open in the middle of the night multiple times and started yelling at me or raiding my room, so now im scared to leave the door open because there wouldnt be a warning if someone was coming in.

i cant have my closet fully closed or open because my mom raided it in the middle of the night when it was fully closed and left it open for me to see that i have no power and she can take whatever she wants when she wants when i was 13 shortly before she kicked me out. i have to have one of the doors open and the other closed or else it stresses me out.

being yelled at is enough to send me into a panic attack or put me on the defensive depending on the day. i'll either breakdown or i'll start picking someone apart at a fundamental level just to make them stop.

if i bring up any type of traumatic event from when i was little, my parents tell me that my childhood wasnt abusive or traumatic and that i have a warped sense of reality because they dont remember any of what im talking about or they dont remember it happening that way, so now i feel like i cant trust my very limited memories of my life.

im so sick of feeling like im crazy or waiting for the other shoe to drop, its insane. at this point i dont know what actually happened and what my brain made up as an excuse for any of my shitty behaviour.

if any of you have similar experiences, or understand where im coming from, please let me know. im sick of feeling like im alone with this.

i hate the fact that theres only one place i can sit in the car that doesnt make me anxious thanks to being yelled at for entire car rides. i hate that i still have nightmares about when my mom kicked me out when it happened almost 3 years ago. 

i hate that i dont like most people touching me because girls in middle school would grab and harass me at school and call me things like "girlyboy" and say i have "henti thighs". 

i hate that i lost most of my empathy because of being relentlessly teased and constantly being kicked out of friend groups for things i either didnt do or didnt know i did because no one would tell me in the most humiliating ways possible, typically either in school hallways or cafeterias. i hate that it always left me in tears, running off into the library barely keeping it together before i could find i secluded area to completely lose it. i hate that i never know what i did to make everyone else hate me a treat me like some sort of freak or a toy they can throw away without rhyme or reason.

i hate it all, and i wish i wasnt so damn fucked up. im not even done with highschool. im almost 16 and all of this shit just keeps hitting me and the punches dont stop. im so sick of it.

title: How to deal with random things setting you off?
content: I had a pretty rough childhood, especially my teenage years. I’ve struggled with trauma, and my older brother was diagnosed with CPTSD from our childhoods so I might’ve even been dealing with something like that. I was pretty stagnant in my mental health issues and felt a weird sense of familiarity/comfort (if that’s the right word) in the symptoms I had been experiencing for the majority of my life. But recently my mom died gruesomely in front of me, and I’m experiencing new issues that are really inhibiting my life and which I don’t have any clue how to handle. The smallest things set me off into crazy dissociative states where I don’t really know what I’m doing — if I’m in public I go into autopilot, and if I’m alone I curl into a ball. Auditory cues are the worst, because I can almost never expect them. My roommates smoke alarm is low on batteries, and while trying to reset it, he accidentally made the alarm in my room beep one time. This freaked me out so bad that I started having what I assume was a panic attack, but was much more “still” than the ones I had before my mom’s death. The beeping reminded me so clearly of a specific moment during her death that I really felt like I was there again. I just stopped what I was doing, covered my ears, and curled into a ball on my bed shaking. This has been happening more and more and I’m not sure how to move forward. It’s only a matter of time before I freak out in front of my girlfriend or my friends, since the whole autopilot thing has been working less and less. Sorry for the long rant, I just don’t know what to do.

title: dental/needle ptsd
content:
im 16 and i haven’t been to the dentist in about two years? maybe three. I got braces in 2019 and planned to have them taken off in 2020, then covid messed everything up. my dentist closed for covid restrictions and i had my braces an additional 2 years. the thing is, i went through a lot from 2019-2023, and i didn’t take care of my teeth. i brushed them like once a week and rotted in a depression pit the rest of the time. when i went in to finally get my braces taken off, i was informed i had like 12 cavities. 

Ive always been afraid of needles since i can remember, i know all kids are but i would kick and scream at poor doctors/dentists just trying to do their job. i was held down a lot as a kid screaming and crying while getting the shots/bloodwork done, and now i feel more afraid than ever. They told me ill have to get atleast 4 shots in all 4 corners of my mouth to numb me, and i couldn’t stand the thought of it. 4 shots?? in my mouth?? ATLEAST?? To top it all off i have genetics that make me process and wear off numbing quicker than most people so thats great. 

I tried to go in and get it done with anxiety meds and laughing gas, the anxiety meds didn’t do ANYTHING for me. I was shaking, crying, and dissociating on the way as usual. I tried to keep calm and just get it over with, but when they put the laughing gas on me i FREAKED. OUT. They had a finger clip thing on me that showed my heart rate, my heart rate got up to 180 bpm before they stopped and informed my mom i would have to be further sedated. 

Here i am now, im still working on getting a therapist to do exposure therapy with, but now i have a new problem. I have a decent sized cavity in my side front tooth. its not in your face noticeable, but i haven’t smiled with my teeth in a while. I just feel so defeated and hopeless. 

I had my girlfriend come with me for blood work that i had been putting off for the same reason. Me and my (old) therapist made a plan, i asked for their best stick and told them i have a needle phobia, and i did it! i got all 4 vials of blood drawn and with barely any crying! it went amazing and really made me feel more confident. The dentist is just such a bigger step though, i know now i can handle one needle, but what if i freak out when i get 4? 
Any advice or anything is very appreciated. I just feel so alone when it comes to this and embarrassed. anyone else have dentist/needle related ptsd?

title: What happened at the shelter (CW: severe animal abuse)
content:
Hey guys, so it’s a little hard to talk about but I wanted to write a bit about a traumatic experience I had in the past, as well as the effects its had on my mental health. I figured this was the best place to talk about it since it’s a really difficult situation to explain to anyone who hasn’t gone through a similar experience. I also find it really hard to actually verbalize rather than just writing it out.

This happened a few years ago, the summer before my freshman year of high school. I had one of my really good friends who was a few years older than me come out to visit family for the summer, and we decided to get volunteer jobs together. We went to this animal shelter a little bit out of town to find work, and we were gladly accepted since they were severely understaffed. 

The shelter was… terrible to say the least? It’s hard to actually describe it in words, verbal or otherwise, as it’s such a visceral memory. Firstly, it was filthy. I don’t even think the word filthy even describes it accurately, its was decrepit and so vile that even remembering some of the things I saw make me ill. There was rotting food and maggots everywhere, pretty much every kind of excrement all over the floor, mold on the ceiling and walls, just to name a few things. This isn’t even to mention the overcrowding, this shelter was taking in at least 3x the amount of animals as it should be.

We were repulsed. Soon after, we found out that the shelter was being ran and almost exclusively care-taken by only one old woman. This lady was insane, theres no kinder way to put it. She was an old polish lady (and was also an ex navy seal instructor if i’m remembering correctly???) She lived out of the office at the shelter and slept on a lice infested futon. She used to scream at us for what gelt like hours, berating us for anything from using the wrong setting on the washing machine to taking too long of water breaks (mind you we were trapped in an unventilated acrid room in the middle of summer in the tropics). One memory of mine involves her forcing me to hold a door shut while several aggressive, large dogs were growling at me to let them out. My friend also recalls a time when she was forced to bury 2 dead kittens out in the front yard.

I don’t know why I didn’t quit, or call animal control or something. I think I felt like I was making a difference, and I was scared of what would happen if I left. I worked mainly with the cats, and when I would take even just one day off the room would be trashed. Plus, the shelter was apparently in the middle of relocating to a different town, so I think I thought it would get better after moving and gaining some more employees. For some sick reason I felt like it was my responsibility to be a caretaker to all of these animals, like I was the only one keeping them from living in revulsion.

Anyways, I stopped working there my first week of freshman year and I thought that the whole ordeal was over, that I had made a difference with the work that I did and that was that. 

On the Wednesday of that week, about midnight, I woke up to my mom pulling me out of bed.
My boss had killed herself and left all the animals alone without food and water for a whole week. In the middle of summer. 

I was so so devastated, I can barely describe the way I felt in that moment. I ended up having to testify to the police and draw them a map of the shelter since they didn’t know what to expect when they went in there. My mom, trying to be a martyr as per the usual, insisted that she brought over dog food to the animals at the shelter. I told her not to go, since it was a crime scene, and I couldn’t stress enough the things that she was about to walk into. Also it was dangerous. A bunch of animals who hadn’t had anything to eat for a week except for each other, can you imagine? Still, despite my begging she still left. I’ll never forget the feeling of sitting on my couch bawling my eyes out thinking that I had failed those poor babies. 

Thats what hit me the hardest, was the guilt about how I could have stopped it all from happening. I forgot to mention it before, but my boss was always talking about how she was going to kill herself, and in retrospect I always felt like I could’ve stopped her from doing what she did too. 

I didn’t tell very many people about what happened, it would be too difficult to explain even if I wanted to. I still have only told my closest friends and my therapist about everything, and I doubt many others will get to hear about it straight from my mouth. Did you know my mom had actually forgotten that all of this happened to me? I brought it up in conversation and she was like “oh I forgot that your boss killed herself” like what?????

I struggled really hard after it happened, I wasn’t able to drive past the shelter without physically gagging or throwing up in my mouth. I still have a very hard time with certain things, especially things like noises or smells. I used to work at a florist, and pretty much had to quit because our backrooms reminded me too much of the shelter. Certain acrid smells make me freak out, along with certain noises like dogs barking. I just recently adopted a kitten to help me cope with some of the things going on in my life (his name is spider, he’s a little tuxedo cat… he’s sitting on too of me right now while im writing this 🐱), and I found it so incredibly difficult to clean his litter box without thinking about the shelter. I was also having bad nightmares about everything for a while, but then I started a new medication which made them stop.

Anyways, thank you for reading this if you made it this far. I know it’s a pretty unusual story, and theres a lot more I could go into about the whole situation. If anyone has any advice on coping with traumatic experiences, or even just any comments I would be happen to hear them. I hope you have a great day!!

title: Questions about PTSD (not looking for diagnosis, simply just wondering if my experiences line up with others)
content:
So, long story short, I randomly got what I think is a memory to being SA'd by a family member when I was very young at a family reuinion, but I don't know if it's real or just my mind making things up. 
I got this "memory" about 2-3 years ago because I was watching a video about something similar. During the video I just suddenly got extremely uncomfortable and started crying and felt panicky and I didn't understand why until I suddenly had that memory. Before that I remembered a lot of things about that family reunion except the memories just cut off after a certain point during the reunion. I never really thought about that but it makes sense as I was about 4 or 5 at that time and all my memories of back then are hazy.
But I still have doubts the memory is even real. Did nobody see it happen when there were tons of people at the house? We were outside but wouldn't I have told someone? Maybe not as I barely tell anyone even now, but wouldn't I have not understood and told someone? The actions that they made me do don't make me uncomfortable at all when I consent to them now, shouldn't it? The feeling I get when I see certain things or hear about certain things (kids being SA'd or family members SAing each other) is far different that normal discomfort, but it's not like every time I hear that stuff I have a panic attack. But sometimes when I hear that stuff I just feel scared and want to cry. Maybe that never happened at all though and I just made it up because I wanted something wrong with me. I know I used to want something wrong with me because people caring for me felt good, but then again I don't tell anybody about it really. I'm perfectly fine with sex and even have been hypersexual a lot of my life (especially as a kid) but I guess it can make me really uncomfortable sometimes and I can even be disgusted by sex sometimes. 
Is this kinda stuff normal to experience with PTSD? I don't get nightmares, and if those spells of being really uncomfortable and crying and kinda dissociating (sometimes to the point I will change personality entirely and feel like I'm watching myself from outside my body while someone else controls it until I feel comfortable again, but that's really rare for me) count as panic attacks they're not super dramatic like a lot of panic attacks I see are. Things related to my trauma don't make me panic but they can do that uncomfortable thing I was just talking about, but only occasionally. Maybe that's just because it was so long ago? I don't know. I have no proof this memory even happened and I feel like I had no recollection of it before I got it, so maybe it didn't happen and my brain is lying to me, but maybe thinking its a lie is also a way of coping. I'm not sure. Does this even sound like PTSD?

title: Attacked by neighbors pitbull
content: I (27f) was attacked by my neighbors dog almost 8 months ago. It happened out of nowhere when I was on a walk with my husband (28m). I was bit several times on my arm and leg, dislocated my knee, went through months of PT, still have bruising and numbness/pain today. I have been going to therapy and was diagnosed with PTSD officially at the 6 month mark. How do I get over this? The hyper vigilance has not gotten better, and I am afraid of all dogs now, no matter the size. Even dogs I knew prior to the attack. I know it isn’t logical and I feel extremely embarrassed any time there is a dog in public, someone’s house, etc. Barking sends me into an episode and I feel like I’m being attacked again. A lot of times I have to completely leave if a dog is barking regularly. No one understands why I’m so afraid. Has this happened to anyone else? What can I do to get through it? :(

title: PTSD after a trip to Spain
content:
Hi Guys,

In Feb 2024, I moved houses and then had a trip planned to Spain in March. One month before the trip, I started to get anxiety and panic attacks daily. I still did the trip however didn't enjoy it. After coming back, the panic attacks continued and eventually developed into anxiety and depression. I visited psychiatrists, got on meds and tried other things like hypnotherapy. Today, I am at a point where I don't get daily panic attacks. However, any event planned causes me anxiety and stress. For example, if someone asks me, ' Are you free on Sunday for a movie', I get shortness of breath and anxiety. It lasts for days and I get triggered.

  
What can I do about this? It's seriously hampering the quality of my life. I can't make any plans and everything has to be spontaneous.

title: Request for Participation in a PTSD Experience Survey
content:
Hello everyone,

I’m conducting a survey to better understand the diverse experiences of individuals with PTSD. My goal is to gather insights on how PTSD affects people across different backgrounds, relationships, and life stages. The responses will be used for research and advocacy, and **all answers will remain anonymous**.

If you feel comfortable sharing your experiences, I would greatly appreciate your participation. The survey includes questions about PTSD symptoms, coping mechanisms, and the role of relationships, and should only take around 5–10 minutes to complete.

Here’s the link to the survey: [https://forms.gle/yT3G6hb7PgYevRhA7](https://forms.gle/yT3G6hb7PgYevRhA7)

title: Severe contamination anxiety
content:
Cw: mention of >!sexual trauma, sexual intimacy and STis!<

I have a massive contamination fear especially when it comes to sexual intimacy in general. I think the way it happened is that i came to see my sexual trauma as a "contamination" that made me disgusting forever, so to avoid that ever happening again I've gotten this fear. One thing i particularly struggle with is if my partner has had other partners before me, because it feels like I'm getting contaminated by not just my partner but their previous partners as well.

I know logically this doesn't make sense and i don't want to think this way. I believe in sexual freedom and that people should do what they want but I can't shake this discomfort even tho it goes against everything I believe in. I recently got a new partner (online) and they told me they'd had less than 10 partners before me (I've only had 1) and just now got tested positive for >!gonorrhea!<, this severely triggered my contamination anxiety even tho they got treated for it immediately.

We had plans about meeting irl but now the thought of intimacy with them makes me repulsed and panic. Logically I know this is just a human thing that can happen to anyone and I don't want to judge them because I still care deeply for them. But it feels like if me and them ever meet irl, especially if we were to do anything unprotected that I'd inherently be "contaminated" by them. 

It'd basically make it feel like the trauma was happening all over again and that I would be getting "tainted". I've been trying to rationalize for hours and hours, telling myself about how cells regenerate, how they got the treatment for the STi and trying to reframe it as them having more experience/practice instead of it being a bad thing. It helped a bit, but I simply can't shake the idea of it inherently "tainting me" forever if I were to do anything with them.

I can't afford therapy as it is now so I'd really like self help type of advice or if anyone else has had a fear like this and how you dealt with it

title: Flashbacks of what didn't happen but is related to the trauma that happened??
content:
I'll try to write in a way that won't trigger anyone but if you need more details or specifics, please feel free to ask!

Hi all, I have (undiagnosed but all the signs are there) PTSD coming from 4 separate events in my childhood, all involving a different person. The thing is, sometimes when something triggers me, my flashbacks start as remembering what happened (which involved >!psychological harm and physical touch but not physical pain<!)but then evolve into even more traumatic stuff (from my perspective at least) which never happened. This evolvement includes >!physical harm and pain<! which is intense. Sometimes it's related to something I watch or read (especially watch), for example a scene involving someone who lives through a traumatic event related to the ones I had. My mind immediately goes forward and even if the person on the TV ends up getting saved or manages to stop the event, I see and feel flashbacks of what could have happened and I literally feel the pain and all the feelings as they were mine and the victim is me. But the false flashbacks can happen also randomly, like normal flashbacks.

Is false flashbacks even a thing? What's happening?

Now some possible TMI which do relate to false flashbacks but aren't necessary for the understanding of the post:  
>!Yesterday I was doing something relating to the trauma topic with someone else but it was something good and I didn't get flashbacks or anything, it was a good event... and then the other person hurt me. 100% unintentionally. The pain was the same pain I always felt in those false flashbacks, this time it was real pain though. I ended up having an awful trauma response, first fawn (which prolonged the pain because the person didn't realize at first), then freeze then flight... It was awful and fighting very hard to not add this to my existing trauma.<!

Then I had two glasses of Prosecco at midnight with my family then when I went back to bed I took a load more shots of vodka. I feel so sick. title: Mom with PTSD having meltdown, won't let us sleep (CW: might be triggering)
content:
Not trying to rag on PTSD. I unintentionally got diagnosed with it recently myself and I've become more sympathetic with her issues. But I am peeved as shit right now.

New Year is her favorite holiday. Unfortunately our functioning alcoholic dad moved back in so he's grumpy and asleep, so we're already trying to be quiet so he'll not wake up and give us shit for waking him up. On NYE, of all nights.

Something is going around and my sister and I got sick with it so we've been mostly sleeping. Sister got it worse. So mom came home, lights are off and dad's asleep and wasted, on her favorite holiday, so she's bummed. Came to us all excited but sister was asleep and I was half-awake, half talking to her because I could tell something was going to happen (she was heavily sighing, staring at me with dead eyes, asking me if she's done something wrong even though I said I'm just nauseous and tired).

She decided to wake my sister up and vent to her about her past and how she's done with everything. Keeps passive-aggressively wanting to make my sister food, and despite her being nauseous and politely saying _no_ over and over, my mom angrily responds with shit like, "Oh, did I do something to offend you? I've had it up to here this year, I'm done with it all."

She got a bunch of clothes offline all wrapped in one big package and she had us sit and watch her unbox everything, urging my sister to sit up and watch, and putting the clothes all out on her bed so she couldn't lay back down
 I'm nauseous again, sister is putting on a brave face but I can tell she feels awful. We're trying to be polite and keep her calm. She's bummed about her favorite holiday. I'm bummed too, I don't want to be sick on NYE. But I don't want to be on edge and trying to appease her because she's having a meltdown and threatening to leave the house (i.e. go get lost until morning, come back and make us feel guilty, like we *made* her do it).

She needs *someone* right now but we're sick as shit. We feel responsible for keeping her head on right now but this shit is... it sucks. Sister can't keep food down but is in the kitchen getting ready to try to eat because our mom will be mad if she doesn't.

Thought I could have an *okay* NYE in spite of being sick but it is now just... whatever this shit is.

Sorry for rambling. Need to vent and get some of it out *somewhere*.

title: Do you ever feel like what happened to you wasn't bad enough to count?
content:
I'm not self diagnosed or anything like that. I've got ptsd, as confirmed by my counselor and therapist. 

Like yes I have all the symptoms of ptsd. I've got the panic attacks and the triggers and the constant feeling that I'll never be safe again. 

But the actual event wasn't *that* bad. I've been abused by my father. But it wasn't really physical. He threw things at me in anger a lot, but I can only remember one time that he managed to hit me. It left a pretty good bruise on my arm, but no permanent marks. 

And like, yeah he did hit me as a kid. But only on the butt, and not out of anger. He thought it was funny I guess? Idk, it didn't happen that often I don't think. I think it only happened as part of someone weird birthday tradition. It's hard to remember exactly how many times he did it. I know it scared me, and that it really hurt. But if it was the birthday thing that'd probably mean it only happened like five or six times? 

It was mostly him constantly screaming at me, insulting me, and embarrassing me. And I know those things are bad, but then you meet survivors who got seriously hurt and you just feel, sorta whiney I guess? 

Like he never left me bloody or hit me with anything more than his hand. I don't have any scars from what happened. Maybe it wasn't that bad and I'm just so sensitive like he always said. 

But I'm so fucked up. I have these horrible physical reactions to loud noises or tones of voice. I can't sleep. I cry constantly. If what happened to me wasn't so bad, why am I so ruined?

title: The Window Of Tolerance: Or, how my nervous system flips the switch so hard
content:
So, I'm a nurse, who worked in mental health and did so much training and PD days in my working life on trauma and PTSD. Even went to Bessel van der Kolk's amazing The Body Keeps The Score course. So I find myself in this maddening "observer" mode. Taking notes of what I am going through. Recording.



I worked in suicide prevention where I developed PTSD post an attack by a client. 



  
Now, I'm flipped to the other side of the window of tolerance, looking in at myself and not sitting alongside clients like I used to. I am my own client. Is that a conflict of interest?



It's surreal. Some days my head is so dazed and confused, full of a tangled thicket of thoughts,



...all thorny and dark.



...my body is heavy as a funeral speech.



...my mouth is cut off from my brain, as if the lights in Wernicke's and Broca's areas are all extinguished.



The thinking in those phases can not be translated verbally to those I love.

  
Hypo-activated.

  


However, on the very same day, my whole system can flip into hyper-vigilant mode, where every cell in it is thrumming with chaotic energy and my fucking leg will not stop shaking and my head will not stop whipping round to see who is behind me. Sympathy for myself is absent in my sympathetic nervous system. It's like I'm the 8-bit pixel-ball in Pong, endlessly batted across the screen of the window of tolerance, back and forth, back and forth. I have no control over the paddles, I just get swatted.

  
Hyper-activated.



Hypo-activated. Hyper-activated. Hypo-activated. Hyper-activated. 



I try and explain to people what it's like to feel like free will is an illusion.

  
"Can you make your heartbeat at exactly 90 bpm a minute for 5 minutes? Can you make your blood pressure exactly 110/80 for the whole day?"

  
because I cannot always squeeze myself back into the window of tolerance when my brain stem has made its primal decision as to which state I am in. I'm Schrodinger's Patient. I can't observe what state I am in until I open the window to observe. And does the observing change, or determine the state? Can I just be me, without watching myself?

  
Hypo-activated. Hyper-activated. Hypo-activated. Hyper-activated.

  
I think I'm rambling at this point.

title: When is enough enough #tw

I usually conquer stuff like this like a champ. But I’m really really tired..mentally and physically. As of late I average about 2 hours of energy each day to try to get things taken care of. I have become very weak and feeble.

The truth is, I don’t have much more of fight left. I know this is a chronic illness, not a terminal one. I’m finding myself extremely irritable most of my waking time. This is not where I’m supposed to be. What happened to all of my dreams… it’s just not fxxing fair. I feel robbed. Ungrounded. And incredibly sad that this is where I’m at.  
Still trapped by emotional scars and still trying to process memories that have haunted me for decades. 

I just needed to get this off my chest.

Thanks for listening .

title: Who would believe me?
content:
This is a thought that really holds me back. I don't know if it's a helpful exercise, but occasionally I'll look back on my life (im in my 30s) and try to organize a timeline of all the bullshit. Every time I am overwhelmed by the sheer volume of events I would need to catalogue. Horror, terror, pain, betrayal, etc color so much of my life that I start to get angry. I start to think about how if my life were a novel, it would be called out for being misery porn and the main character that is me would 100% be dragged as a Mary Sue. Incredulity at the gates.

It stops me from participating in groups, it stops me from speaking my truth, it stops me from letting anyone in. It feels like I have a sign around my neck that says "I am a one-upper". I know they say that hurt people seek out more hurt, or at the very least attract people that will hurt them further, but good lord. Gotta think, at what point is it me? What is my share of the blame? After all, i put myself into risky situations because I simply did not care what happened to me. I descended that ladder to the depths, no one else made me.

It's important for me to put it down in a tangible list, and I suppose I need some level of validation so here it goes:

Mom started doing hard drugs when I was 10.

I started drinking at 11, heavily drinking at 13.

Mom tries to kill me when I'm 16.

I'm gay. Was outed to my intolerant family when I was 17.

Enlisted as an escape rope. Became a medic.

Began drinking again in earnest during training. Raped by a colleague, then sexually assaulted by a supervisor.

Transfered to a MASH/CASH. War happened.

I catch my SO cheating, break off the relationship, only to discover the scene of her attempted suicide the next morning.

No mental health help to be found anywhere. Redoubled my already alarming drinking, blacking out every night as close to my barracks room as I could get. Raped no less than a dozen times.

Many friends die.

I leave the military, start trying to get my shit together. Stay with parents. Mom steals my medication.

Next relationship ends with her saying I'm physically abusive and tells my family and friends I am actively homicidal so I have nowhere to go for help.

Turn to an old friend. He confesses feelings for me. I rebuff his advances. He has a full psychotic break before threatening a mass terrorism event in my name.


These are the big things I can think of off the top of my head. There are 10,000 tinier moments I'm sure I could put down, but all these felt about equal weight.

I feel like people spend their whole lives in therapy for just one of those things. It's hopeless, the work to undo all this damage will never end. And of course, I am always there in the back of my own mind to remind myself:

Who would believe you anyway?

title: I think I want to be alone forever.
content:
TW: suicide, guns, police, DV

Advice also welcome. This will probably be kinda long, hopefully not too confusing. I'm feeling fairly distressed.

I'm a 32 year old widowed single mother. It will be four years in February. My husband killed himself after I told him I wanted a divorce. I still loved him, but I was miserable and had grown afraid of him. He had a lot of his own mental health issues. The end of our relationship was awful. I tried to stop him the night he killed himself. He was really mad and pushed me down in front of our son. My sister was there and I told her to take our son in the spare room when my husband started going for our gun. There was a physical altercation when I tried to take the gun from him. He cut off my air a couple times. When he got away from me he loaded the gun and was screaming at me to get out of his house. I grabbed our coats, shoes, and purses and went and got my sister and my son. She was on the phone with the police. As we went outside, about 15 police cars were pulling up. I gave her the keys and put my son in the car. He was three years old and shaking and told me that he was scared. I told my sister to pull over in a church lot close to our house, so I could give the police a report. We gave our statements and she called my dad to come sit with me so she could take my son to his house to get some sleep. My dad and I sat in the parking lot for eight hours while SWAT tried to talk my husband down. Suicide is illegal in my state and it was a nice neighborhood. We weren't big gun people, but the gun was an old Russian rifle, so he had lot of ammo because of how it came. 

Now I've been in a relationship for about a year and a half. I kinda knew I wasn't ready, but I really liked the guy and I thought if I waited until I was ready, I would be waiting forever. I thought I could learn as I went. I was retraumatized when I was arrested for a DUI and again when I went to jail. Now I'm on probation and two months sober. A few months ago I began to feel like I just wasn't ready. Things have gone generally well, but he's wanting to move in together. In the beginning I fantasized about living together and how nice it would be, but I think I was deluding myself. I have a bad habit of taking on the dreams of my romantic partners and convincing myself I'll be happy living the life they want. Now the idea of doing that all again is horrifying to me. I don't want to live with someone else. I need a lot of alone time and I like having my own space. I don't want to have to compromise or feel out of control. I still have a very difficult time saying no. I don't want to have joint accounts or shared bills. I don't want to rely on someone else. I don't want to feel trapped. It doesn't help that my son, who is now seven, doesn't really like my boyfriend that much. My boyfriend does great with him, but they just have clashing personalities. I'm also starting to feel like we don't want the same kind of life. I feel terrible. I know I need to end it. He has been so nice and patient and supportive. I owe him a lot of money which makes me really uncomfortable. I was trying to let him help me, because I'm not good at that, but I feel like I should have said no. Right now I feel like I just want to be alone. I don't have the energy or space to be in a relationship. I'm a shell of who I used to be. Making dinner for a man is triggering. Doing his laundry is triggering. Cleaning for him in general is triggering. Sometimes being told I'm beautiful or sexy is triggering, I went through a hoe period after my husband died and heard things like this from a lot of men, I used to enjoy the complementa but it makes me feel gross now. Like I'm an object, prize, or trophy. Something to be obtained and kept. I need to put everything I have into me and my son. I need the space and freedom to live the life I want. I've felt a little pressure from my father to be in a relationship. He thinks I need to figure out my issues with relationships and that my son needs a father. But my son doesn't have a father. He's gone. And forcing a man on him that he doesn't really like isn't better. 
Lately I haven't wanted to see my boyfriend at all. I don't miss him, I dread seeing him. I feel bad that I feel this way, but I can't get around it. I try to be there and be present when we're together. And I enjoy our time while I'm there, but eventually I start getting antsy and I want to go home and when I'm home I feel how wrong it is. I think I understand now why you should wait to have sex in a relationship. It muddles things. It feels like our relationship got ahead of the conversation. I like him, I'm attracted to him, he's sweet, and supportive, and patient, but we have different lifestyles and want different things. I just feel so guilty. I don't know how I let things get so far. I feel like I woke up from a daze. Like I was just going along. I wasn't really present. 

Thanks if you're still here. 

ETA since I've been sober a lot of stuff has been coming back up. All the shit I pushed down for years. I miss my husband a lot. I'm grieving him in a way I hadn't before. He was mentally ill, but he was still my best friend and the father of my child. He was angry and controlling, but he got me in a lot of ways that one else ever has. I had a great love, especially in the beginning, before I got pregnant and things got bad. I don't know if I need another one. I want to be the cool aunt with the cool son. I want to put all my energy into making life the best I can for me and my son. We've had such a hard time and we both deserve that. I want to live all the dreams I shelved to be in a romantic relationship. And maybe along the way I'll meet someone who actually wants the same things. But for now, I just want to be alone. I want to feel peace and relationships just don't give me peace. Is it ok if I'm never ready?

title: This Christmas Eve
content:
Not exactly sure what to title this. It feels like it was yesterday, and it’s just been ringing through my head ever since. This Christmas Eve might have been my worst Christmas. Christmas time has never been good for me. Growing up in an old immigrant family that didn’t believe in mental health problems for women I was locked in the attic or made to walk the streets due to my inability to hear certain noises or I cry. (sensory issues. I am on the spectrum) 
Last year I thought was going to be my worst Christmas. My brother (25M) is a big guy and has a lot of problems. A lot. He attacked my veteran father in front of my grandmother at her home and then blew up screaming, running out of the house. She was sobbing frantically, in the beginning stages of dementia. She passed in October, that was her last Christmas. My mom had left to go home when I was home with a friend in the garage. She texted me to get inside immediately, afraid my brother was going to come back and try to kill us because of previous incidents he has done so. We were fearing for our lives, my dad waiting at a nearby bar to try to catch him walking by since it was a very long walk. He wasn’t wearing shoes or even a coat and since it was winter and freezing some people called the cops. That stopped him from hurting us. 

Back to the present

This Christmas Eve was…I don’t know how to even explain. My brother has been destroying our house and aggressive to all of us, shoving us, eating all of our food (holiday and not) won’t let us in the kitchen or he becomes aggressive, ect. He’s unemployed because he can’t keep a job and he’s a few months sober from substances after he had a massive overdose in September and had multiple seizures so he can’t drive either. He’s made our lives a living hell in so many ways I don’t have room to type. He can be so kind, but yet he can be so cruel. His personality flips instantly and he can become hostile. 

We were driving in the car on the way to church for Christmas Eve at 11pm. I was sick and had just gotten off a long shift at work but I was bearing through it because it was the only thing my dad asked of us. Not even a few minutes in and my brother who was next to me was beginning to flick and prod me painfully, trying to provoke me. He suddenly began to spew all of this hateful stuff, cussing me out and then hitting my leg. I can’t even remember what was happening but he has these moments of delusion and violence. He was saying something about how he was the happiest person in the family (he is severely depressed and aggressive and is never happy, and makes all of us live in fear) and I finally had enough. I told him that he was not happy, because he was mean to us constantly. There was a pause, I thought he’d be quiet from there. Without warning he struck me multiple times, as hard as he possibly could. I screamed, and the car stopped immediately as both of my parents began to break down. My dad was about to cry, yelling “I can’t do this anymore. Why (brother name), why?!” And my mom was crying and begging him to stop. Everybody jumped out of the car at once. I was frozen on the road as my dad ran to my brother making sure he wasn’t going to hurt me anymore and my brother ran up to my dad and was holding onto his arm. My mom took the car and had to coax me and nudge me in because I was frozen. I just started sobbing from there. 

This is summarized as short as I possibly can with context, but I now have massive bruises all over my body. Massive. They hurt. They’re ugly. They’re still dark purple now and turning ugly yellow. He’s hurt me a lot in my life but it hasn’t been this bad in a long, long time. Customers were staring at me at my job the other day. Some of them whispering about the bruises. That was just my arm, but they didn’t even see my leg. It’s so embarrassing and I want to curl away. I’m 21F. He is 25M. He is so much bigger than me, twice my literal height and weight. I kept telling myself it wasn’t that bad until the next morning I saw how large the bruises were, and how many there were. 

Sorry for how long this is. It’s going through my mind so much and I’ve been going through so many emotions. I’ve been leaving my room to work, but I’ve just been sleeping so much more now. Staying in my room. My parents bought him an apartment for Christmas because of how violent he has been to everybody. Then Christmas Eve happened. He’s caused my dad’s health to deteriorate, his hair instantly greying over the course of a year. The doctor says that he is at high risk of a heart attack over everything my brother is putting my dad through. None of us can take it anymore. 

Ever since then he’s been so mean. Shoving us, cruel, I stay away as much as I can.

title: Repressed dreams?
content:
Part of my therapy involves filling out the same questionnaire at the beginning of each appointment.  Basically tracking symptoms.  The one that always makes me pause and think is something like "do you have dreams/nightmares about your traumatic event?"

For the most part, I don't remember dreaming at all, and when I do, they're abstract and weird.  So I usually check "not at all" or "rarely" for that one.  

But here's the thing: I often avoid sleep.  Like, I'll find literally anything to do if it means staying awake.  Like, it'll be 3am, and I'll be doing dishes by hand because while I avoided them all day, suddenly now is the best time to do it, even if I'm exhausted.  Only when I'm well and truly about to keel over do I trudge into bed.  Or if my wife drags me there by the ear (and not in the fun way).

Which has left me with a theory.  What if I *do* have nightmares about my trauma which I repress, but my subconscious remembers and wants to avoid the nightmares by not going to bed?  I've brought this up with my therapist and psychologist, and they've agreed that it's certainly a theory.  But I kinda feel like they agree in the "OK, crazy guy, whatever you say" kind of way.

I guess I'm not really looking for medical advice, just . . . I'm just tired of being tired all the damn time.  I'm tired of sleepless nights and wakeless days.  I'm tired of being hypervigilant all the time and never letting my guard down, even around people I love and trust.  To quote Henry Caville, "I can't fucking sleep!"

title: Re-enacting traumatic event during a PTSD flashback?
content:
Is it possible to act out the traumatic event, including exhibiting behaviors and making decisions that are contrary to your current morals, values, and standards, but are the exact behaviors and decisions you made when the traumatic event originally happened? 

I believe my husband had a severe ptsd flashback that caused him to break from reality. I know I said something to him that triggered his trauma (though I wasn’t aware of it at the time) and his behaviors and actions following were the exact things he had done during the original trauma, even though they highly conflict with who he is now. When I asked him why he did what he did, he retells this story that brought him there and I’m not mentioned in it once. It’s as if I didn’t exist. He only mentioned the people and circumstances from 18 years ago and laid it out like it was currently happening in his mind. He didn’t even realize what he was saying, but I recorded the conversation so I could play it back later and he doesn’t even recognize himself or what he’s saying. In the recording, he didn’t have any memory at all of his current life, he only described things from 18 years ago. 

Is it possible to re enact the trauma and not just visualize it or relive the emotions?

title: Foster dog attack
content:
My wife, S, works for the local animal shelter as a behavior tech. She works with dogs who need and deserve a little extra love. One such dog was languishing away in the shelter and on a quality of life euthanasia list, so we brought her home for a few days. 

On the morning of the 26th, the dog saw one of our cats (who we had been keeping separate for their safety- as we didn’t know how the dog would react to the cats) and hoped the gate we have that separates our bedrooms from the rest of the house. She bolted for the cat- my wife’s soul cat. S ran after the dog, and through some very quick thinking, S got the dog to let go of the cat’s leg and Crusty-said soul cat- got away clean. My wife wasn’t so lucky. The dog turned and latched on to her arm and wouldn’t let go. I relive those agonizing minutes while we both struggled to get the dog’s mouth open, over and over. I got the dog off of her and into the bathroom, where I shut the door. My wife’s arm had suffered extensive damage from the biting. Cue an ambulance, animal control, and all manner of amazing friends who came to “crime scene” clean our house. 

I am so beyond grateful that the ultimate cost was ~100 stitches. No lasting or significant muscle damage, no nerve or tendon damage. I should be so grateful. But I’m still so scared. If there’s not noise around me, the sounds of get screaming ring in my ears, the smell of her blood and fear-sweat and the dog’s saliva is still in my nose. And there’s still blood on the wall that paint hasn’t been able to fully cover. 

What do I do? How do I make it stop? I’m mourning the normalcy we lost, the safety I felt in my own home, my peace of mind. Anything, anything at all would help.
